name: Companies that introduced new or significantly improved products new to the company's market or new only to the company, by industry, industry proportions, and company size: 2013–15
description: Companies that introduced new or significantly improved products new to the company's market or new only to the company, by industry, industry proportions, and company size: 2013–15

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: field_new_or_significantly_improved_products_companies_number_a
variableMeasured.description: New Or Significantly Improved Products Companies Number A

variableMeasured.description: New Or Significantly Improved Products Yesb

variableMeasured.description: New Or Significantly Improved Products Noc

variableMeasured.description: New Or Significantly Improved Products New To Company S Market Companies Number D

variableMeasured.description: New Or Significantly Improved Products New To Company S Market Yes

variableMeasured.name: field_new_or_significantly_improved_products_new_to_company_s_market_no

variableMeasured.description: New Or Significantly Improved Products New Only To Company No

specialValues.D: suppressed to avoid disclosure of confidential information

notes: Detail may not add to total because of rounding. Industry classification is based on the dominant business code for domestic R&D performance, where available. For companies that did not report business codes, the classification used for sampling was assigned. Sum of "Yes" and "No" responses may not add to the total number of companies or, for the percentages, to 100% due to item nonresponse to some items.
sources: National Science Foundation, National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics, and U.S. Census Bureau, Business R&D and Innovation Survey.
